content.description:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> is a real number.

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the square root of 9 minus x squared, end root, for negative 3 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 0. f of x, equals, negative x plus, 3 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator pi times x, and denominator 2, close parenthesis, for 0 less than x, less than or equal to 4." overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>{</mo> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr> <mtd> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>9</mn> <mo>−</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </msqrt> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext>for</mtext> <mspace> </mspace> <mspace width="0.45em"> </mspace> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>cos</mi> <mo>⁡</mo> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>π</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext>for</mtext> <mspace> </mspace> <mspace width="0.45em"> </mspace> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

Let <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined above.
content.question: (a) Find the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 3 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text: (a) Find the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 3 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Find the average value of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 3 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(d) Must there be a value of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> attains an absolute maximum on the closed interval <math alttext="negative 3 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?  Justify your answer.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
